content: goblin creature greg materials yarn - any weight hook - any size to match the yarn you re using yarn in a second color to embroider the face polyfill for stuffing optional safety eyes pipe cleaners to insert in the arms/legs notes gauge doesn t really matter - just match your hook size to the yarn you choose using a 4mm hook and mystery acrylic yarn from my stash greg is about 9 inches tall and 3 5 inches wide legs are 6 inches tall body is 3 inches tall pattern is written in us terms stitches single_crochet = single_crochet single_crochet increase = single_crochet increase single_crochet twice into the same stitch single_crochet decrease = single_crochet decrease single_crochet two stitches together i used invisible decreases arms - make 2 notes you can insert pipe cleaners in the arms to give them more bend/shape-ability if desired - do this before stuffing stuff gently every 10 or so row crochet more row for longer arms fewer row for shorter arms row 1 magic_ring single_crochet 6 6 r2 single_crochet increase x6 12 r3 single_crochet around 12 r4-37 single_crochet around 12 sew both edges together for a flat seam and tie off leaving long string to attach to body legs - make 2 notes again you can insert pipe cleaners in the legs to give them more bend/shape-ability if desired - do this before stuffing stuff gently every 10 or so row crochet more row for longer legs fewer row for shorter legs the first leg will be tied off while the second leg will continue into the body row 1 magic_ring single_crochet 6 6 r2 single_crochet increase x6 12 r3 *single_crochet single_crochet increase* x6 18 r4 single_crochet around 18 r5-44 single_crochet around 18 first leg tie off second leg continue on to row 45 r45 chain 6 single_crochet into the next stitch from where you tied off the first leg single_crochet around the first leg then single_crochet in each of the 6 chains single_crochet around the second leg single_crochet back across the other side of the 6 chains 48 r46-49 single_crochet around 48 r50 *single_crochet 7 single_crochet increase* x6 54 r51-64 single_crochet around 54 stuff gently insert safety eyes if using continue stuffing every few rounds r65 *single_crochet 7 single_crochet decrease* x6 48 r66 *single_crochet 6 single_crochet decrease* x6 42 r67 *single_crochet 5 single_crochet decrease* x6 36 r68 *single_crochet 4 single_crochet decrease* x6 30 r69 *single_crochet 3 single_crochet decrease* x6 24 r70 *single_crochet 2 single_crochet decrease* x6 18 r71 *single_crochet single_crochet decrease* x6 12 r72 single_crochet decrease x6 6 close off loop and tie off finishing sew both arms to the sides of the body embroider on a mouth and eyes with your second yarn color if not using safety eyes sew in all ends
